bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, January 24, 1948

div1.p: Hench discusses the plans to memorialize the room where Reed died.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, January 24, 1948
div1.opener:
Y. F.
January 24, 1948
Colonel J. F. Siler
1835 Eye Street, N.W.
Washington 6, D. C.
My dear Colonel Siler:
div1.p:
I have just received your letter of January
15, also one from General Truby came today. He has
already written to the commanding officer of the Army
War College asking for a floor plan of the second
floor. I see that you now call it Fort McNair. I
didn't know the name had been changed. Was it
changed just recently? I will tell General Truby
that you will be glad to visit the commanding of-
ficer of General Truby's correspondence with him
does not produce results.

I think it is very nice that General Truby
was able to identify the room and that we have at
long last located it and I am very hopeful that
the Army will grant the request of the Walter Reed
Memorial Association to mark the spot with a modest
plaque.
div1.closer: Always sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
